dialogs.text: A new day begins — and that email invitation still waits in your inbox. But this time, instead of nervousness, there’s a flicker of curiosity.
Alright, Aira said we’d talk about teams today… wonder what she’s got planned.
Good morning, future hacker! Ready for your next mission?
Her tone is the same as ever — warm and full of zeal. You can’t help but feel her energy is infectious.
I think so. I mean… as ready as I’ll ever be.
Perfect answer! Because today, we tackle the most powerful force in any hackathon.
Code?
Nope!
Coffee?
Close — but still no. The answer is… Teamwork!
This is the Collaboration Hub — a space where ideas meet people. Every hackathon begins here.
Whoa, it’s busy! Everyone seems to know what they’re doing.
Don’t be fooled! Most of them are first-timers too. The trick is: nobody knows everything — and that’s okay. That’s why teams exist.
But how do I even find a team? What if nobody wants to work with a beginner like me?
Ah, the second most common fear — right after ‘what if I break something?’ Trust me, every hackathon is full of people looking for someone just like you.
Let me introduce you to a few types of hackers you’ll meet. Think of it as... your future squad audition.
Three avatars fade in — one at a time, each with their own personality and color theme.
Luna — the Designer — waves, surrounded by glowing shapes and color palettes.
Hey there! I’m Luna — I make things look beautiful and usable. You know, colors, buttons, layouts. Without design, even great ideas feel dull.
So you’re the artsy type?
Sort of! But it’s more than art — it’s understanding people. I make sure the users actually enjoy using what we build.

Designers are like empathy wizards — they turn chaos into clarity. Despite what most say considering the age of generative AI, they are indispensable. After all, nobody knows aesthetics better than humans.
Next appears Kenji — the Developer — his avatar framed by lines of cascading code.
Sup. I’m Kenji — I code stuff. I’m not great at talking, but give me a bug, and I’ll squash it faster than you can say ‘runtime error’.
Wow, you seem… intense.
The coder’s rather stoic lips that were forming a flat line curl into a soft smile.
I just like seeing ideas come to life. But coding alone? Nah. You need others to bring a project to the finish line.
Developers are the builders — they make things work. But without an idea, they have nothing to build. They thrive with direction and collaboration.
Lastly appears Maya — the Presenter — standing confidently with a glowing mic in hand.
Hiya! I’m Maya — the storyteller. My job? Convince the judges that our idea changes the world.
So you’re like… the face of the group?
Exactly! But it’s not about fame — it’s about making sure people understand our vision. A strong pitch can turn a small project into something unforgettable.
Presenters are your voice. They connect your ideas to the world. They understand code, concept, and design enough to bring imagination to life.
So, you see? Hackathons are like orchestras. Every role plays a different note — but together, they make music.
I get it now… it’s not just about who’s smartest. It’s about combining strengths.
Exactly! Some people code. Some create. Some communicate. The best teams respect that balance.
But what if I still don’t know what my role is?
Then that’s your challenge for today.

dialogue.text: Time for the Team Builder minigame! Let’s see if you can match each hackathon task with the right role. Ready?
Think of it as your first team management simulation. Don’t worry — you can’t get fired.
After your mentor — or Resource Assistant — speaks, a hologram pops up labeled “Team Builder Sim: Version Byteon Prep.”
MiniGame: “Team Builder” — Drag and drop each role to the correct task.

minigame.description: Aira (voice-over): Drag and drop each role to the task that fits them best!

tasks.task: Fix a bug in the login system
Create the app logo and branding
Prepare and deliver the final pitch
Connect the frontend to the backend API
Organize the team's project plan and timeline

dialogue.text: Impressive! You’re learning fast. You built a balanced team — and more importantly, you understood why each role matters.
That was… kinda fun, actually. So hackathons are really like RPG parties, huh?
Exactly! Developers are warriors, designers are healers, presenters are bards — and you? You could be anything you choose.

minigame.completion_message: Great job! You matched the roles perfectly—your teamwork sense is leveling up!

achievement.title: Team Player
achievement.description: Matched all roles correctly in Team Builder. Teamwork skills leveled up!

events.text: Amazing! Now you understand how each team member contributes!
A strong team is the secret to winning — or at least having a great hackathon experience.

events.prompt: Which role do you feel most right now?

choices.text: Designer — I like making things look and feel right.
Presenter — I love telling stories and connecting with people.

dialogs.text: Ah, the builder type! You love logic, structure, and making ideas tangible. Your code is your craft — keep sharpening it.
Ah, a creative soul! You’ll make sure every detail speaks to the user. Design is how innovation meets emotion.
A natural communicator! You’ll make ideas shine and inspire others to believe. Pitching is storytelling with purpose.
That’s perfectly fine. Hackathons are the best places to find your role. You’ll discover what fits by trying things — and maybe surprising yourself.
You’ve completed your second quest!
Nice! I’m starting to feel like I actually belong here.
And that’s the point. The best teams aren’t made of perfect people — just curious ones who show up.
The digital space slowly fades. You sit at your desk, notebook open, scribbling ideas. For the first time, the word “hackathon” doesn’t feel intimidating. It feels… exciting.
Next stop — The Idea Sprint! Let’s spark your creativity.
Music swells as the screen fades to black.

achievement.title: Teamwork Makes the Dream Work
achievement.description: Complete Chapter 2 of How to Hackathon
